revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = Power |cpu1_type_rev = e500 |cpu1spd = 800 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Spansion;FL128SAIF00; |flash1size = 16 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 128 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5TQ1G63DFR-H9C; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Atheros;AR8327N; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = A0:F3:C1, F8:1A:67 |oui = A0:F3:C1, F8:1A:67 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = U-Boot;;; |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 2 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 3.3,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = yes |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = abgn |defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = TP-LINK_2.4GHz_XXXXXX, TP-LINK_5GHz_XXXXXX |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |is_manuf = Yes |tpfirmware = OpenWrt, DD-WRT |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = 2015 |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 01/2013 |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9580; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Atheros;AR9381; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "2050500289" and "Rev:1.0" is silkscreened on the board. *CPU: [[Freescale Semiconductor]] QorIQ P1014 (@800 MHz) :Hardware NAT acceleration w/ [[Atheros]] AR8327N switch :(.. but not currently, [https://dev.openwrt.org/ticket/11779 or likely anytime soon, with OpenWrt]) {{SCollapse | Per '''TP-LINK''''s specs... • >> | 
*'''EIRP:''' < 20dBm
*'''Receiver sensitivity'''
**2.4 GHz
***450Mbps: -71dBm
***300Mbps: -71dBm
***270Mbps: -71dBm
***195Mbps: -72dBm
***130Mbps: -74dBm
***54Mbps: -78dBm
***6Mbps: -94dBm
**5 GHz
***450Mbps: -66dBm
***405Mbps: -66dBm (300Mbps??)
***270Mbps: -67dBm
***195Mbps: -70dBm
***130Mbps: -73dBm
***54Mbps: -75dBm
***6Mbps: -90dBm
|}} ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.tp-link.com/resources/simulator/TL-WDR4900/Index.htm Firmware Interface] *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=42062 On the '''OpenWrt''' forums] ([http://pastebin.com/Mf6xNjwD OpenWrt boot log posted by ''Gabor Juhos'']) :[[Freescale]] P1014 @800MHz (P1014RDB board), 128MB DRAM, :168c:abcd (hm.) and 168c:0033 (AR9580) PCI IDs *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/tp-link/tl-wdr4900 On the '''OpenWrt''' wiki] :There would appear to be two versions of the device.. :*v1 - worldwide version, ''[[Freescale]]'' based :**F8:1A:67 OUI, per the censored label :**[https://dev.openwrt.org/changeset/36051 changeset (r36051) adding profile build image for the device] :*v2 - China only, '''QCA''' QCA9558 based :**[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=42099 v2 on the OpenWrt forums] *[http://www.redeszone.net/tp-link/tl-wdr4900/ Review on redeszone.net (ES)] (w/ excellent internal photos) :De-heatsinkized CPU visible as a [http://www.freescale.com/webapp/sps/site/prod_summary.jsp?code=P1010 ''Freescale'' P1014NSN5HFA (P1014)] :- not a P1010.. but there does not appear to be anything significantly :different between the two models [http://cache.freescale.com/files/32bit/doc/brochure/P1010APPBRF.pdf?fpsp=1 P1010 appears to have 3x GbE SGMII] :(vs. P1014's 2x) and trusted boot support :WiFi chips visible in their photos as AR9580 (AR9580-AR1A) and AR9381 :USB 2.0 hub (P1014 has only 1x USB 2.0) is a [http://www.genesyslogic.com/_en/product_01_1.php?id=42 '''Genesys Logic''' GL850G]. *[http://uk.hardware.info/reviews/3992/tp-link-tl-wdr4900-review-tp-links-best-router-yet Review on uk.hardware.info] :specifies WiFi chips as AR9385 ('''no''') and AR9381 ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = tl-wdr4900v1 build 21318 20130418 Please insert instructions here ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/tp-link/tp-link_tl-wdr4900_v1 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/tp-link/tl-wdr4900 |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=42062 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = mpc85xx |subtarget = p1010 |arch = powerpc_8540 |support_started_version = 14.07 |current_supported_version = 23.05.0 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==Pictures==
